metadata.title: CVE-2022-48856 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:gianfar: ethtool: Fix refcount leak in gfar_get_ts_infoThe of_find_compatible_node() function returns a node pointer withrefcount incremented, We should use of_node_put() on it when doneAdd the missing of_node_put() to release the refcount.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48856` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-117-generic - 5.4.0-117.132~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-117-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-117.132~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-117-lowlatency - 5.4.0-117.132~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-117-generic - 5.4.0-117.132~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-117-lowlatency - 5.4.0-117.132~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-kvm - 4.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-16.19').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-117.132~18.04.1').
